test_cases.name: End-to-End Workflow: Create Formula Metric and Set Custom Target
preconditions: A valid user account with appropriate permissions must exist.
The user must have access to the specified company.
The two metrics used in the formula ('[Name of first metric to use in formula]' and '[Name of second metric to use in formula]') must exist in the system prior to test execution.

test_data.Metric Name: [Name of the metric to be created]
test_data.First Metric: [Name of first metric to use in formula]
test_data.Second Metric: [Name of second metric to use in formula]
test_data.Custom Target Values: [4 values from highest to lowest - Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, Level 4]

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed correctly.

test_steps.action: Enter a valid email address into the email input field and click 'Continue'.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the correct password into the password input field and click 'Login'.
test_steps.expected_result: The company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Locate and click on the specified company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The main dashboard page is displayed, confirming successful login.

test_steps.action: From the navigation menu, click on 'Metrics'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Metrics' page is loaded and displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Metric Name' into the name input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric name is correctly entered in the field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Value Source' dropdown and select 'Formula'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Formula Builder' interface appears, showing a search field and operator buttons.

test_steps.action: In the 'Search Metric' field, search for and select the 'First Metric'.
test_steps.expected_result: The first metric is added to the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Click the desired 'Operator' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected operator is added to the formula display area.

test_steps.action: In the 'Search Metric' field, search for and select the 'Second Metric'.
test_steps.expected_result: The second metric is added to the formula display area, completing the formula.

test_steps.action: Verify the formula is correct and click the green checkmark button to confirm.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is accepted by the system.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button on the metric creation form.
test_steps.expected_result: A confirmation message is displayed indicating the metric was created successfully.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the 'Dashboards' menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the KPI selection modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The KPI selection modal opens, showing available and selected metrics.

test_steps.action: In the left panel of available metrics, locate and click the newly created metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric moves from the left panel (available) to the right panel (selected).

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes and the dashboard refreshes to show the newly added metric card.

test_steps.action: Hover over the newly added metric card, click the three-dot menu button, and select the 'Edit' option.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is navigated to the 'Edit' page for the metric.

test_steps.action: On the Edit page, select the 'Target' tab.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration options are displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Custom' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: Four input fields for custom target levels (Level 1, 2, 3, 4) appear.

test_steps.action: Enter the four 'Custom Target Values' into the corresponding input fields in descending order.
test_steps.expected_result: All four fields are populated with the correct numeric values.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration is saved, and the page navigates back to 'My Dashboard'.

test_steps.action: On 'My Dashboard', locate the metric card.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card correctly displays the visual indicators for the four-level custom target.

test_cases.name: Metric Management: Successful Creation of a Metric Using the Formula Builder
preconditions: A valid user account with appropriate permissions must exist.
The user must have access to the specified company.
The two metrics used in the formula ('[Name of first metric to use in formula]' and '[Name of second metric to use in formula]') must exist in the system prior to test execution.

test_data.Metric Name: [Name of the metric to be created]
test_data.First Metric: [Name of first metric to use in formula]
test_data.Second Metric: [Name of second metric to use in formula]

test_steps.action: Log in to the application and navigate to the 'Metrics' page.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is successfully on the 'Metrics' page.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter a unique 'Metric Name' into the name input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The name is correctly entered in the field.

test_steps.action: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Formula Builder' interface is displayed.

test_steps.action: In the 'Search Metric' input field, enter the name of the 'First Metric' and select it from the results.
test_steps.expected_result: The first metric appears correctly in the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Click on an 'Operator' button (e.g., '+').
test_steps.expected_result: The operator appears correctly in the formula display area next to the first metric.

test_steps.action: In the 'Search Metric' input field, enter the name of the 'Second Metric' and select it from the results.
test_steps.expected_result: The second metric appears correctly in the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Verify the complete formula is displayed in the format: (Metric) [Operator] (Metric).
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is constructed and displayed correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is validated and accepted by the system.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button on the metric creation form.
test_steps.expected_result: A confirmation message is displayed, indicating the metric has been created successfully.

test_cases.name: Dashboard & KPI Customization: Add a Pre-existing Metric to 'My Dashboard'
preconditions: A valid user account with appropriate permissions must exist.
The user must have access to the specified company.
The metric to be added must exist in the system and not already be on 'My Dashboard'.

test_data.Metric Name: [Name of first metric to use in formula]

test_steps.action: Log in to the application and navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed with the 'My KPIs' section visible.

test_steps.action: Locate and click the 'Edit KPI' icon/button.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal for selecting KPIs opens, displaying a list of available metrics on the left and selected metrics on the right.

test_steps.action: In the left panel (available metrics), locate the desired pre-existing metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is found and is not present in the right panel (selected KPIs).

test_steps.action: Click the metric in the left panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric automatically moves from the left panel to the right panel.

test_steps.action: Locate and click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes, and the dashboard page begins to refresh.

test_steps.action: Verify the dashboard has refreshed.
test_steps.expected_result: The newly added metric card is now visible in the 'My KPIs' section on the dashboard.
